titles.title: Ecce Homo (from the Passion Christi, series of 14 woodcuts)

historicEventInformations.remarks: 'Kurze und einfältige Auslegung der Episteln und Evangelien, so auf die Sonntage und vornehmsten Feste durch das ganze Jahr gelesen werden', Antonius Corvinus, Georg Rhau, Wittenberg [http://gateway-bayern.de/VD16+C+5354; accessed 11-07-2019]

'Kurze und einfältige Auslegung der Episteln und Evangelien, so auf die Sonntage und vornehmsten Feste durch das ganze Jahr gelesen werden', Antonius Corvinus, Georg Rhau, Wittenberg [http://gateway-bayern.de/VD16+C+5350; accessed 11-07-2019]

Passio D.N. Iesv Christi Venvstissimis Imaginibvs Eleganter Expressa ab, Luca Cranogio Anno. 1509., Visscherius, Amsterdam; On the title-page part of 'The Celestial Ladder of St Bonaventura' (H078a). The Lamentation is missing in this edition. All blocks have cracks and broken lines.
Passio D. N. Jesu Christi, venustissimis imaginibus eleganter expressa ab illustrissimi Saxoniae ducis Luca Cranagio Anno 1509. Wittenberg
'Passionalbuch. Vom Leiden und Auferstehung unseres Herrn Jesu Christi', Georg Rhau, Wittenberg [http://gateway-bayern.de/VD16+B+4780; accessed 11-07-2019]
'Passionalbuch. Vom Leiden und Auferstehung unseres Herrn Jesu Christi', Georg Rhau, Wittenberg [http://gateway-bayern.de/VD16+B+4782; accessed 11-07-2019]
'Passionalbuch. Vom Leiden und Auferstehung unseres Herrn Jesu Christi', Georg Rhau, Wittenberg [http://gateway-bayern.de/VD16+B+4786; accessed 11-07-2019]

pageContext.description:
Ecce Homo from the 'Passion Christi', a series of 14 woodcuts.
Of the series only the second block is signed with the monogram LC, the winged serpent and dated; The Flagellation, The Crucifixion and The Resurrection are signed with the winged serpent insignia.
The prints were distributed both in editions of single sheets and bound in books. Numerous editions between 1509 and 1616 have been recorded.
[cda 2019]

ref.description:
Christ before Caiphas from the 'Passion Christi', a series of 14 woodcuts.
Of the series only the second block is signed with the monogram LC, the winged serpent and dated; The Flagellation, The Crucifixion and The Resurrection are signed with the winged serpent insignia.
The prints were distributed both in editions of single sheets and bound in books. Numerous editions between 1509 and 1616 have been recorded.
[cda 2019]

additionalTextInformation.text:
In Hollstein the Passion series is illustrated in the correct order, but two titles have been swapped around: the correct title for no. 12 is : 'Christ before Caiphas' and respectively no. 13 depicts 'Christ before Annas' 

[cda 2019]

ref.description: - version with decorative frame and lettered text
ref.inscription: Below the image, lettered: '8. Er hatte keine gestalt noch Schöne, wir sahen jn, aber da war keine gestalt, das wir sein hetten mügen / begeren. Esaie liij.'

ref.description:
The Flagellation from the 'Passion Christi', a series of 14 woodcuts.
Of the series only the second block is signed with the monogram LC, the winged serpent and dated; This image as well as The Crucifixion and The Resurrection are signed with the winged serpent insignia.
The prints were distributed both in editions of single sheets and bound in books. Numerous editions between 1509 and 1616 have been recorded.
[cda 2019]
ref.signature: Artist's insignia in the block, lower margin: serpent (with elevated wings)
